thread.title: Cross country: Montclair, MKA run well at county All-Class meet
thread.title_full: Cross country: Montclair, MKA run well at county All-Class meet

title: Cross country: Montclair, MKA run well at county All-Class meet
text:
Cross country: Montclair, MKA run well at county All-Class meet October 22, 2015 Last updated: Thursday, October 22, 2015, 12:32 AM The Montclair Times Print 
The Montclair High School and Montclair Kimberley Academy cross country teams put forth strong efforts at this past Saturday’s Essex County All-Class Championships at Brookdale Park, combining to capture four team flights and four individual races. 
The meet, in which runners competed only against runners in the same grade, included a 2-mile course for freshmen boys and girls, and a 3.1-mile (5-kilometer) course for the sophomores, juniors and seniors. 
Local winners included Montclair High’s Stefan Urquidi, who won the freshman boys race in 11 minutes, 24:41 seconds, and Juliet Kohli (senior girls, 19:26.76); as well as MKA’s Nick Wilson (sophomore boys, 17:16.63) and Bill Massey (junior boys, 16:31.56). 
The Montclair freshman boys earned top honors in their flight, with Urquidi, Andrew Skibinewski (2nd, 11:28.17) and Harrison Blanz (5th, 12:01.37) all placing highly. 
The Mountie senior girls swept the top two spots, with Kohli followed shortly by Lia Schattner (19:34.21), to earn first place in the team standings. Grace Harrison (6th) and Zoe McClellan (10th) helped the winning effort. MKA’s Kathryn Correia took third overall, finishing in 20:13.09. 
MKA’s sophomore boys, thanks to Wilson and Matt Petrocelli (5th, 17:51.87), edged Columbia for the flight win in their category. 
Also victorious were the Montclair senior boys, with Geoff Minet (3rd, 17:00.35), Imran Khawaja (7th, 17:45.40) and Jamie Keys (10th, 17:56.93) leading the way. The top local finisher in that event was MKA’s Billy Hughes, who was the runner-up in 16:53.25. 
On the individual level, MKA’s Caylie Privitere (2nd, 20:50.86) and Montclair’s Amelia Lufrano (3rd, 21:11.06) had strong races in the junior girls category, while the MHS girls also took second as a team in the freshman girls, paced by Noa Zielinski’s fifth-place finish. 
MHS and MKA will turn their focus now to the championship season as the 2015 fall season heads down the home stretch. 
The season’s next big event is the Essex County Championships, which will be held Friday afternoon, Oct. 30, at Brookdale Park in Montclair. The NJSIAA championships begin the following weekend with sectional meets on Saturday, Nov. 7.
